reviews.review_msg: Easy prof and very helpful.. her exams are from the loncapa assignments and her notes.. dont really need to study the textbook just use it for extra practice.. do lots of practice from the end of the chapters!

She was the best prof.. she was like a highschool teacher, easy to talk to and very fun. She talks about her kids and her life if you get to know her. She helps you alot if you have problems. Overall the best prof so far for chem, take a course with her if you can!
Pretty good prof, she's very nice, does lots of experiments in class and prepares very detailed and clear notes. Her exams are fair.
Good explainations, good notes

He got a mic setup this semester so people could hear him better and it's helped so much. Just generally he's a considerate lab professor that's always on hand trying to make sure things run smoothly. Probably the only member of the SFU faculty that knows how to brew a potion

Literal Dogwater! This ugly old man is the worst lab professor ever! He strictly enforces mask wearing while he himself walks around and yells at students with his mask off! All he does is mumble when he talks and no one can understand anything! And shuffles around, he can barely walk and his hands are look like the hands of a WITCH it's unsettling
I appreciate the detailed practice questions and the math component.
I feel sorry for his incomprehensible and undetailed lectures. We always appreciate how ever smart one can be, understanding of what you teach!

yes. they replaced him after 3 weeks because none of the students had any idea what they were doing or where to study from. in the lectures not one student came. wonderful proff he was. he can improve by being a little less nervous and understanding his own notes and implanting loncapa instead of his useless and incomprihensible assignment and note
No Comments
His office is too hot. Doesn't like students using his office hour. Seemed easy because he taught it though.

Teaching: i guess everyone feels the same way!exams: he donesn't even know the right answer.Even TAs hate his exam. "How's that???Scalng:. Eventhough Class average was 65% he didn't scale it. Worst part??50-59% was D. and 60-67% is C-. so i guess alot of people get C- this semester for f****** chem 122 course.

Worst Prof Ever. Not worth the money and time on this "teacher" that can't teach, think, or talk with confidence in front of people. Does not scale? Mayb he teaches good in higher level, but not 122. Complicates simple matters. Forgetful, Irresponsible,  unwilling to help, no interest in course. Take it and REGRET IT. Better to wait for nxt prof.

WORST prof EVER encountered.Can't communicate.Do NOT address his problems.TOO quiet.Half his answers to tutorial questions were wrong including his solution to the midterm.Won't respond to emails.BORING.Makes the simpliest question into the most complex nonsense.Can't understand his OWN notes.POOR prof, take it& you'll REGRET it.PS. check finalexam

This guy is an ****.. he doesn't scale the class no matter how poorly everyone's doing. he doesn't care about students who address him with a problem. didn't know how to use teh mic on the first day of class. His notes are a jumble of crap. Half of which is wrong and needs to be corrected by students. too much crap to say about him. boring too.

Conceptually, this class is straight forward. But when taught by Wilky, the simpliest concepts become extremely difficult to grasp. His notes are composed of endless variables which add to the confusion.

Clearly has large amounts of knowledge in chemisty.  However, he comes across as a very nervous person who lacks social competency.  He stutters a lot and mumbles.  I think teaching large groups such as this class make him uncomfortable.  He might be a better upper division course teacher, but I would NOT recommend taking this class with him.
too monotne. lighten up!
I swear he's nervous when students are around...he has office hours but doesn't like that when students go and ask him questions. In my personal opinion, he shouldn't teach chem 122.
poor communication skills of course materials
If you think his class is hard, then its your problem. even with a funky accent the material is so gr 12. all you need to do is read the text and do practice midterm/final to do well
He does have that funky accent,but overall i think the level of difficulty is alright. basically its all like Chem 12 AP

Though he has an accent made of chinese and french, understanding him maybe hard. but he's a nice guy and notes are ok. hw is alright.for mid and final just read text and study from review pkgs. Dr. Ye is funny cuz he accidently made the fire alarm go off once lol

This guy is the worst prof I have had at SFU. His lectures are very difficult to follow, he has a very thick accent. Going for help is useless as he rarely attends his office hours. Going for help after lecture is no better. He quickly brushes you off and at best refers you to the T.A for help. I have no positive things to say about this prof.
An Average prof, has a funky/funny accent that can be extremely funny at times. Tests are fair. He Loves the material hes teaching but doesn't pace himself well and rushes through the end.

He was born in China, grew up in France and then came to Canada. He has an asain/french accent which makes it impossible to understand him. Overall he is really nice and seems to LOVE what he's teaching. Tests are fair and multiple choice. Only downside is the accent.
He seems really nice, but his accent makes him impossible to understand in class. He doesn't  go into much detail for concepts. Tests were all multiple choice.

nice person, willing to help students. watch out his notes come from the textboook. can be hard to understand since his english is not fluent. suprising his 2nd language is french for an azn guy. funny how he always show demos 45s b4 class ends, he always go like " no no no plz dont go" in such an accent.
moron
His english was good, tests easy... fairly simple course really.
not good at all .... slept through all his lectures and his explanation is very unclear ... his english is very poor!! THE MIDTERMS AND FINAL R VERY TOUGH!!!
not one of the nicest prof out there, he just copy notes straight from the textbook
his notes are good, cant understand wat he says in class...also not very nice
English is terrible, can't pronounce anything properly, went to him in person; very hard to deal with and not a nice guy at all. Only good thing is his notes are decent.
HE CAN'T SPEAK ENGLISH!!!                                        enough said, BUT, his exams are pretty tough, and he's mean!!!!
No Comments
Gives very thorough notes!
Takes awhile to get used to the accent but he is really helpful when approached in office hours.
so far the tests are not too hard... he has a harsh accent but he is very easy to talk to and compromise with. very easy going. nice guy knows his stuff...pretty good teacher all around
Powerpoint notes, but they are unclear.  All exams are multiple choice.  Very hard to understand.

He is one of the worst profs I've ever had. The fact that he is funny and nice like most reviews say literally doesn't matter! Avoid taking with him if you can. He rambles about random stuff most lecture and doesn't walk through any examples. His exams are insanely difficult and not like the lon-capa or iclicker like he says.

He's a nice and funny guy but the exams are really hard and did not reflect what was taught in class. The midterm average was 48% and was extremely difficult. However he did make the final easier than the midterm which helped my grade a lot. Overall he's a decent guy but this course and exams are really challenging so be ready for that.

He's a nice guy but exams were very difficult. It's all quantitative but he barely goes over any examples so you need to teach yourself. The hmwrk and exam questions far exceeds the level of difficulty in any examples given in lecture or the textbook. Basically just a self taught course. Average for the midterm was 48%.

He is honestly one of the worst profs I've ever had. His lectures are useless but mandatory since iClicker is 10% of your grade. You need to have the textbook so you can teach yourself and his exams are insanely difficult.

Dr. Yu is great, he's funny and makes the lectures tolerable because of that. Chem 122 is very quantitative so there is a lot of math and if it weren't for his sense of humour and nice personality, it would be really tough. I would definitely recommend taking this one with him!
Very chill prof and approachable. Exams contain no tricks very related to Lon Capa practice. Nothing bad to say about him
must take with him
love hogan hes great
Very fair exams and nice person. Highly recommend
The exams are similar to the iclicker questions from the lectures and the loncapa, and the final was the same difficulty was the midterm.

Not a bad chem prof better than most. But the biggest thing is read the textbook (there's an online version). Everything on his lecture is from the book. Midterm was a little tricky but the final was very straightforward as it's worth 55%.

Just do the LON CAPA questions, since exams are identical to those style styles of questions. 
Review I-Clicker questions as well. 
I don't think he scaled since the class average was C+
awesome

He isn't too bad of a prof and seems like he cares about what he's doing. His tests were fair and based off of lon capa assignments. Textbook practice questions also helped with the course and he is an approachable and friendly guy.
I'm his biggest hater!!!
Lectures are absolutely useless, tutorials absolutely useless, have to teach yourself everything from the textbook, and exam questions are confusing. Too much effort for a 2 credit course

lectures suck so much. tutorials are competely useless. but exams are fair and no trick questions, if you understand the material. ur gonna have to teach everything to yourself tho, bc his lectures only confuse. loncapa hw was doable, and sometimes he takes loncapa questions verbatim and puts them on exams.

He's not the best lecturer by any means. His English isn't perfect therefore doesn't perfectly get his point across. The required textbook from Chem 121 was very helpful filling in knowledge gaps. Lon-Capa was fine and the exams were largely based off Lon-capa which was great. Beware, questions also come from the lab Lon-capa, be familiar with them

Just like all the previous comments are saying, avoid taking this class with Hogan if you can try taking this class with a different Prof!!! Lectures were not useful or good at all. Midterm and Final was hard and you will have to teach yourself everything to get through this course.
Yu decide

Does not explain the concepts well, confuses himself and the students during lectures and office hours. All source for studying is the 10 weekly questions in LON CAPA that are nowhere near the difficulty level of the exam. Don't take this course with this professor!
The prof does not explain well so you have to rely heavily on the textbook and external sources. However, exams and quizzes were fair.
Simple concepts being taught but horrible layout of the exams with no feedback after the midterm so you just have to guess what you couldve gotten wrong. Take the class with another prof if you can

good prof, lectures short, tests like lon capa, does waste time and goes over previous lecture in new lecture and repeats himself but was easy to forward the video due to it being recorded. Solid prof taught the material pretty straightforward

just read the textbook if you can't avoid this prof. he barely explains anything, this entire course was self taught. he put some unexpected questions on the exams that were also out of so few marks that you could get a few wrong and have a 60% on the midterm.

He doesnt know how to explain properly, READ THE TEXTBOOK IT EXPLAINS EVERYTHING, you get free 15% by the polling questions which are the exact same as in the lec, highly recommend doing Lon capa and understanding it fully, his midterm and final is nearly identical to that.

The course material isn't that hard - Thanks to Khan Academy. The prof simply does not care! He's got the "blame online learning" card ready at all times. My suggestion: AVOID him at all costs; he will actually get you to hate chemistry! I feel like the only way you can do well with him as prof is if you're an expert on the material beforehand.

Just don't. Wait for anyone else, if you can ofc. I am literally struggling for a 2-credit course. I've started to hate chemistry. If you do end up taking his class, befriend your TA because does not care. LON Capa are merely an indication, don't really completely on them. I've literally completed this course on my own - relying on self study.

Very dense lecture slides, but they are helpful for exams. He's kind of funny, and he knows what he's talking about. Didn't like how his office hour and the TAs office hours were all on one day, but overall he taught a good, straight-forward course.

Nice guy but: 1. Lectures are useless (it's all self studying) 2. Exams are way more brutal than LON CAPA 3. 60% final that's way too hard 4. In office hours, he's the human embodiment of Stoicism. He doesn't explain well and jumps between subjects without completing them. 5. If you'd have to wait a semester for another prof do so.

Do not take CHEM 122 with this professor. Here are some reasons: 1. Lectures are useless. You have to self-study 100% of the material regardless of in-person or online. 2. If you thought LON CAPA was hard: You get 2 hours to complete 30 LON CAPA questions as Midterm. No partial marks. 3. The Final is 60% and is more brutal than Midterm.
dude is great I love him
not bad

Good. He puts in effort, so much better than other professors I've had. Goes through material pretty quickly. Slides are quite condensed and packed, so it's hard to follow along calculations made, sometimes. READ THE ZUMDAHL TEXTBOOK (Chemical Principles) CUZ IT CLARIFIES EVERYTHING. Content is not hard. Calculations based class. Nice dude. Ez cred
chemistry is always a hard class, you need to work for it. he has thick accent but you get used to it. not the worst prof but not the best

Definitely not the best prof in SFU, but not the worst. Hogan lacks quite a bit in being able to explain certain concepts to his students, and this is where most will find difficulty with him. That being said, his lecture slides generally have everything to pass but it will need effort outside of class. Passable, but you'll need to be self-reliant.

He doesn't provide any study materials other than LONCAPA which sucks. Final was a lot harder than the midterm and a lot of students felt unprepared for it. Mandatory iclicker questions every lecture. One thing to keep in mind is that he ends his course a month early, so the final is around end of March.
Final was hard, course was overall okay. I dropped 3 letter grades after the final. Just saying... I got a D.

Like a lot of students, I found myself enjoying class. Dr. Yu has a thick accent, but after the first few lectures, you'll find yourself being able to understand him with no problem. I never felt distracted during his lectures because he was engaging and often cracked jokes. The midterm was decent, but I found the final to be quite difficult.

I would say Yu is very average. Not completely useless as a teacher (iClickers were used well), but not overly interested in the success of his students. Did not provide additional study resources beyond LONCAPA and kept our midterms, as if we would be stealing chemistry itself if we had them in hand. 42 students got 90+ on MT, final was brutal.

Although not great, Hogan is definitely not a terrible prof. He has a thick chinese accent, which just takes getting used to. This is a hard course, and will be no matter who is teaching it. There is lots of homework (lon capa), and 1 midterm, which was easy (i got an A). Beware of the final though, it is 60% and was much harder than the midterm

Prof definitely knows his stuff, but he isn't the best when it comes to explaining things. I went to his class primarily for iclickers, never understood anything during his lectures. Midterm was easy, final was way harder but fair. Make sure you know how to do every loncapa problem and every iclicker in his lecture slides. Slightly harder than 121.

Disappeared after final, never respond email as students are furious about hard brutal Final exam that worth 60%...... Not good at explaining concept, you are becoming more confused if you attend lectures.

prof, with heavy chinese accent from shandong province. loncapa is annoying, due every week, and complicated data and really hard questions. Only 1 midterm, is quite easy. However, final worth 60%, is extremely BRUTAL!! 25 MULTIPLE CHOICES, 4 big written, so many people failed. he is not clear at explaining things, study hard yourself!

Dr Yu is always willing to give extra help, even outside of office hours. He has some accent but imo it's not too bad. His lecture's are clear and logical, and he's good at telling jokes. Tests are easy as long as you study for them. Don't be too intimidated if the clicker questions get tricky, as they don't worth much but they are good practice.

I found Dr. Yu to be a funny guy, but I did not learn much from his lectures, he overcomplicated things for me, and I found it hard to concentrate. Midterm was easy, final was brutal.  Do every relevant textbook question, that the only way to pass this class. If you can wait for another chem 122 prof, I would recommend it.

I do not recommend him at all. He's not useful at all. I had to learn on my own. He only lectures maybe 30 mins. He reviews for 10 mins by saying exactly the same thing. Waste of time. And waste 10 mins on 2-3 iclicker questions.  He's explanations were not clear at all. Really hated going to the class. Had to sit in for iclicker.

In spite of the other ratings here, I think Hogan is one of the good professors at SFU. He is a little difficult to understand, but he makes up for it by keeping the class interesting. Exams were on the easy side. Attendance is marked (via iClicker). Recommended!
hard to understand. killer final just wrote it today hopefully class avg is low

His class was a joke...the exams were so easy you could write the exam twice (not to mention many people got 100% on his final)...BUT DONT GET TO EXCITED BECAUSE HE CURVED DOWN AT THE END OF THE COURSE

I now know why ppl says he's one of good professors teaching Chem in SFU.He understands students n tries help and encourage them to pass the course. Read through the text and try to grasp the concept,study lec notes(his notes are well organized) and pratice lots of problems(especially on the book). Then you will be okay.
Accent hard to understand but notes are well done. Easier tests than most so far

Very nice as a person, but tends to be disorganized and very hard to understand, even once you get over the accent. Too many times has he made the wrong answer right for iClicker questions, or finished an entire example wrongly and decided "Whatever, you get it!" ..No. We don't. Probably a great prof for upper level/NOT CHEM 122.
Horrendous accent, I'm sorry. I had to sit in the very front seats and focus on DECODING what he says.

Like all the rest of the comments say,i'm sure he's a nice guy and has a great sense of humour,however this doesn't matter as his lectures are horrible.It's very hard to understand what he's saying past the accent,yes his notes are good,but if you take this class with him be prepared to teach yourself from the text,hopefully you will have a good TA
